title: [Large-Scale] Game Theory-Based Peer Learning Design: Collaborative Learning Strategies in Social Sciences

context.prior_knowledge: Basic game theory (Prisoner’s Dilemma) and foundational social science knowledge
context.additional_context: Conducted in blended classroom settings using digital devices (tablets/laptops), learners engage in case analysis and discussions based on their professional experiences

learning_goals: Learners enhance their ability to establish cooperative strategies during peer learning by applying the prisoner’s dilemma model.
Learners derive solutions for resolving social conflicts with over 80% accuracy through game theory-based simulations.
Learning groups achieve over 75% participation rates and a 20% or higher improvement in academic performance based on PD_PL mechanism evaluations.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
